010package imagingbook.pub.dct;
011
012import imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix;
013
014/**
015 * This class calculates the 1D DFT using tabulated cosine values.
016 * This version is considerably faster than the naive version without tables.
017 * Other optimizations are possible.
018 * 
019 * @author W. Burger
020 * @version 2019-12-26
021 */
022public abstract class Dct1dDirect {
023
024        final double CM0 = 1.0 / Math.sqrt(2);
025        final int M;                            // size of the input vector
026        final int M4;                           // = 4*M
027        final double s;                         // common scale factor
028        final double[] cosTable;        // pre-calculated table of cosines
029
030        private Dct1dDirect(int M) {
031                this.M = M;
032                this.M4 = 4 * M;
033                this.s = Math.sqrt(2.0 / M); 
034                this.cosTable = makeCosineTable();
035        }
036
037        private double[] makeCosineTable() {
038                double[] table = new double[M4];        // we need a table of size 4*M
039                for (int j = 0; j < M4; j++) {          // j is equivalent to (m * (2 * u + 1)) % 4M
040                        //double phi = j * Math.PI / (2 * M);
041                        double phi = 2 * j * Math.PI / M4;
042                        table[j] = Math.cos(phi);
043                }
044                return table;
045        }
046        
047        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
048        
049        public static class Float extends Dct1dDirect implements Dct1d.Float {
050                
051                private final float[] tmp;              // array to hold temporary data
052                
053                public Float(int M) {
054                        super(M);
055                        this.tmp = new float[M];
056                }
057
058                @Override
059                public void forward(float[] g) {
060                        checkLength(g, M);
061                        if (g.length != M)
062                                throw new IllegalArgumentException();
063                        float[] G = tmp;
064                        for (int m = 0; m < M; m++) {
065                                double cm = (m == 0) ? CM0 : 1.0;
066                                double sum = 0;
067                                for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
068                                        sum += g[u] * cm * cosTable[(m * (2 * u + 1)) % M4];
069                                }
070                                G[m] = (float) (s * sum);
071                        }
072                        System.arraycopy(G, 0, g, 0, M); // copy G -> g
073                }
074
075                @Override
076                public void inverse(float[] G) {
077                        checkLength(G, M);
078                        if (G.length != M)
079                                throw new IllegalArgumentException();
080                        float[] g = tmp;
081                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
082                                double sum = 0;
083                                for (int m = 0; m < M; m++) {
084                                        double cm = (m == 0) ? CM0 : 1.0;
085                                        sum += cm * G[m] * cosTable[(m * (2 * u + 1)) % M4];
086                                }
087                                g[u] = (float) (s * sum);
088                        }
089                        System.arraycopy(g, 0, G, 0, M); // copy g -> G
090                } 
091                
092        }
093
094        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
095        
096        public static class Double extends Dct1dDirect implements Dct1d.Double {
097                
098                private final double[] tmp;             // array to hold temporary data
099                
100                public Double(int M) {
101                        super(M);
102                        this.tmp = new double[M];
103                }
104
105                @Override
106                public void forward(double[] g) {
107                        checkLength(g, M);
108                        if (g.length != M)
109                                throw new IllegalArgumentException();
110                        double[] G = tmp;
111                        for (int m = 0; m < M; m++) {
112                                double cm = (m == 0) ? CM0 : 1.0;
113                                double sum = 0;
114                                for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
115                                        sum += g[u] * cm * cosTable[(m * (2 * u + 1)) % M4];
116                                }
117                                G[m] = s * sum;
118                        }
119                        System.arraycopy(G, 0, g, 0, M); // copy G -> g
120                }
121
122                @Override
123                public void inverse(double[] G) {
124                        checkLength(G, M);
125                        if (G.length != M)
126                                throw new IllegalArgumentException();
127                        double[] g = tmp;
128                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
129                                double sum = 0;
130                                for (int m = 0; m < M; m++) {
131                                        double cm = (m == 0) ? CM0 : 1.0;
132                                        sum += cm * G[m] * cosTable[(m * (2 * u + 1)) % M4];
133                                }
134                                g[u] = s * sum;
135                        }
136                        System.arraycopy(g, 0, G, 0, M); // copy g -> G
137                }
138        }
139
140        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
141
142        // test example
143        public static void main(String[] args) {
144                {
145                        System.out.println("FLOAT test:");
146                        float[] data = {1,2,3,4,5,3,0};
147                        System.out.println("Original data:      " + Matrix.toString(data));
148        
149                        Dct1d.Float dct = new Dct1dDirect.Float(data.length);
150                        dct.forward(data);
151                        System.out.println("DCT spectrum:       " + Matrix.toString(data));
152        
153                        dct.inverse(data);
154                        System.out.println("Reconstructed data: " + Matrix.toString(data));
155                        System.out.println();
156                }
157                {
158                        System.out.println("DOUBLE test:");
159                        double[] data = {1,2,3,4,5,3,0};
160                        System.out.println("Original data:      " + Matrix.toString(data));
161        
162                        Dct1d.Double dct = new Dct1dDirect.Double(data.length);
163                        dct.forward(data);
164                        System.out.println("DCT spectrum:       " + Matrix.toString(data));
165        
166                        dct.inverse(data);
167                        System.out.println("Reconstructed data: " + Matrix.toString(data));
168                        System.out.println();
169                }
170        }
171
172        //      Original data:      {1.000, 2.000, 3.000, 4.000, 5.000, 3.000, 0.000}
173        //      DCT of data:        {6.803, -0.361, -3.728, 1.692, -0.888, -0.083, 0.167}
174        //      Reconstructed data: {1.000, 2.000, 3.000, 4.000, 5.000, 3.000, -0.000}
175
176
177}
